The act of demolishing someone's house is generally considered morally unacceptable, even if it is done at the request of a stranger. Without his neighbor's permission, Hank would be performing an action that is not only harmful to his neighbor but also, by extension, could cause harm to the wider community.

Breaking moral or legally accepted rules should only be considered if it can help to serve a greater good. In this case, while Hank may be doing what the stranger has asked him to do, the consequences could still result in severe harm to his neighbor.

Therefore, it is generally considered morally unacceptable to perform an action that, knowingly or without malicious intent, could cause harm to others.
